title: East Malaysia
summary: East Malaysia (Malay: Malaysia Timur), also known as Sabah, Sarawak and Labuan (Malay: Sabah, Sarawak dan Labuan)[1] or Malaysian Borneo,[2] is the part of Malaysia on and near the island of Borneo, the world's third largest island. It consists of the Malaysian states of Sabah and Sarawak, as well as the Federal Territory of Labuan. Labuan is an island in a small archipelago near the coast of Sabah.[3] East Malaysia lies to the east of Peninsular Malaysia (also known as West Malaysia), the part of the country on the Malay Peninsula. The two are separated by the South China Sea.[4][5]
